sessions.description:
In this hands-on workshop, participants will learn about the Fission methodology for building Federated GraphQL APIs. Moving beyond theory, attendees will experience how an intent-first approach transforms the way teams design, implement, and govern distributed schemas. Workshop participants will:

  • Collaboratively design an ideal schema based on real-world use cases
  • Translate high-level intents into concrete service boundaries
  • Experience real-time schema collaboration with the Fission toolkit
  • Define governance workflows that evolve naturally with architecture changes
  • Deploy a working Fission-powered GraphQL Federation setup This workshop is ideal for API architects, engineering leads, and developers working with distributed systems who want to get a new perspective on collaborative API design. By the end, participants will have practical skills to implement a Fission-like approach in their own organizations, enabling teams to better collaborate while preserving autonomy. Prerequisites: Basic familiarity with GraphQL concepts and microservice architectures. Participants should bring laptops with Node.js or Go installed.

sessions.title: Pentesting APIs with AI Agents: A Practical Workshop
sessions.description:
APIs are a major attack vector today, and traditional pentests can’t keep pace with rapid development cycles. In this workshop, we’ll explore how Aikido’s new AI Pentest leverages autonomous agents to map, probe, and exploit API endpoints - uncovering complex vulnerabilities that previously required a human expert.

You’ll learn:

How AI agents behave during an API pentest

What kinds of vulnerabilities they surface in minutes

How to interpret findings and apply fixes

How AI pentesting complements your existing security stack

The goal: a practical look at what AI can automate today and how it fits into real-world API security.

sessions.description:
Ready to move from theory to action? In this workshop, you’ll learn how to design, govern, and manage APIs and AI agents that drive real business impact. Building on the strategies from “The False Economy of Speed: Why Skipping API Governance Leads to Agentic Technical Debt,” this session will help you see best practices put into action—fast.

  • AI Agentic to improve productivity around API generation, testing, mocking, etc ... This use case demonstrates how agentic AI can be embedded to enhance automation, decision-making to optimise the number of API avoiding redundant API. It highlights the potential of AI agents to streamline workflows, improve efficiency.
  • Federated API Management This use case focuses on implementing a federated approach to API management based on four foundational pillars: Monitoring, Subscription, Governance, and Policy Management. It illustrates how organizations can manage distributed APIs across multiple environments maintaining consistency, security, and policy alignment.
  • API Studio The third use case introduces API Studio, a development environment that supports the authoring, configuration of policies and testing. It supports MCP (Model Context Protocol) interface and other advanced features that simplify integration, enhance collaboration.

sessions.title: Risk-Proof Your AI: APIs and the New Rules of Governance
sessions.description:
Agentic AI is revolutionizing industries—but without strong API governance, it’s a recipe for risk. As AI agents gain autonomy, managing risk and compliance is more critical than ever. API governance is your safety net, providing the unified governance needed to keep AI safe, scalable, and successful.

In this workshop, discover how to architect for federation and enforce governance, including how Boomi helps organizations to securely leverage agentic protocols like MCP. See real-world examples from manufacturing, healthcare, transportation & logistics, and financial services—where Boomi API Management powers secure, agentic AI at scale.

Join Markus Müller, Global Field CTO, API Management at Boomi to learn:

Why API governance is essential for risk management in agentic AI How to architect for federation—balancing control and agility Real-world examples of secure, scalable AI powered by Boomi

Walk away ready to protect your business and lead confidently in the age of agentic AI.

sessions.title: Finding the Signals That Matter When It Comes to AI Integration
sessions.description:
The signals you need to understand the state of your enterprise AI integration can be found in the existing outputs of your private and public business operations. These public and private signals describe the services you depend on to do business and provide the rich metadata you need to understand, align, and organize your internal, first-party, and third-party APIs into meaningful domains aligned with your desired business outcomes—revealing the maturity, costs, and platform considerations of your operations, which will shape what your teams are capable of when it comes to AI integration.

Join Kin Lane, Co-Founder and Chief Community Officer (CCO), for a workshop on the signals that will matter when it comes to determining what your enterprise is capable of regarding AI integration. We'll get hands-on exploring the investments of 30+ companies across finance, retail, and other top business sectors, organizing the third-party APIs they depend on into business domains while understanding the maturity and platform considerations and thinking about the costs associated with third-party resources—shaping what we are capable of when it comes to AI integration.

In this workshop, we will take signals from 30+ companies and demonstrate how they can be used to drive enterprise AI integration capabilities.

Companies - Gather signals from 30+ companies across 15 industries.

Investments - Evaluate the investment signals for companies by industry.

Services - Understand the top services in use across the enterprise.

Domains - Organize the resources of services into business domains.

Maturity - Look at the value generation and commoditization of services.

Platform - Understand where a company is in its platform journey.

Pricing - Consider the pricing across cloud, SaaS, and AI integrations.

Capabilities - Consider how declarative capabilities can be leveraged.

sessions.title: Turning Exposed Uris Bulletproof: Securing APIs with HAProxy
sessions.description:
Modern APIs are constant targets. While many organizations rush to implement heavy, complex API management platforms, a lighter, faster alternative is already in your stack.

Stop attacks at the edge, not in your application. In this hands-on session, we’ll take a deliberately vulnerable API and lock it down live, demonstrating how to transform HAProxy from a load balancer into a high-performance Security Gateway.

Key Takeaways:

  • Smart Rate Limiting: Stop DoS attacks with context-aware rules based on user tiers, not just IP addresses.

  • Traffic Validation: Reject malformed headers and payloads at the perimeter before they exploit your code.

  • Auth Offloading: Push API key and JWT verification to the gateway using HAProxy ACLs.

Whether you are patching legacy services or architecting new ones, you need a security layer that doesn't add latency. Join us to get a practical blueprint for securing your APIs immediately, maintaining the high performance HAProxy is known for, while stopping threats before they threaten everything.

sessions.title: The Future of AppSec Is Dynamic: Hands-On Exploration with Burp Suite DAST
sessions.description:
Dynamic Application Security Testing (DAST) has never been more critical. As modern applications evolve toward complex microservices and API-first architectures, security teams need visibility that keeps pace with real-world attack surfaces. In this hands-on workshop, we’ll explore why dynamic testing remains a cornerstone of effective AppSec, and how Burp Suite DAST brings scalable, automated security testing to both web applications and APIs. We’ll break down when to use Burp Suite Pro and when DAST is the better fit, helping you choose the right approach for different stages of your development and security workflows. From there, we’ll dive directly into a live demonstration of Burp Suite DAST, including:

End-to-end web application scanning
Robust API scanning, including configuration of common authentication types (Header-based, Token-based, API Keys, OAuth, etc.)
Security analytics and reporting
Flexible API integrations, including examples of custom integration patterns

Whether you’re modernising your AppSec program or just getting started with dynamic testing, you’ll walk away with practical knowledge, real examples, and plenty of time for questions.

The Platform Model for Enterprise Scale
sessions.description:
Most enterprises today have an API strategy, but few have an execution model that can scale with business growth, regulatory complexity, and AI-driven innovation. Fragmented toolchains, siloed ownership, and disconnected governance often lead to inconsistent delivery, security gaps, and poor developer adoption. This hands-on workshop with APIwiz demonstrates how a unified Platform Model helps enterprises bridge the gap between vision and execution. Participants will explore how to:

  • Establish a single control plane for APIs across multi-gateway, hybrid, and federated environments.
  • Implement governance that accelerates, not slows, delivery — enforcing standards through automation.
  • Enable shift-left security and compliance from design to production.
  • Drive observability and lifecycle visibility that link API performance to business outcomes.
  • Prepare APIs as the execution layer for AI agents and autonomous systems, ensuring readiness for emerging workloads.

Through live platform walkthroughs and real customer examples, the session will reveal how APIwiz helps large organizations achieve consistent delivery, predictable operations, and measurable business impact — all while keeping control, compliance, and speed in balance.

sessions.description: Heard about GraphQL but not sure how to approach its security? This talk breaks down everything you need to get started with GraphQL hacking. We'll cover the essentials: understanding GraphQL's core concepts, identifying vulnerabilities unique to its flexible nature (like information disclosure via introspection), and exploring how attackers abuse its power. Discover how modern AI tools can act as your hacking co-pilot, assisting in finding flaws even if you're new to the game. We'll bust the myth that GraphQL is inherently more secure and show you practical ways to test these APIs. This is your beginner's guide, designed to empower you to confidently start exploring GraphQL vulnerabilities. It's everything you wanted to know about hacking GraphQL (but didn't know how to Query).

sessions.title: Learning to Connect: Our Collective Path to AI Integration
sessions.description: We are all learning, not just how to build with AI but how to connect with it. Over the past years, APIs have evolved from simple interfaces into ecosystems that boost business, untangle IT, and enable seamless cooperation. The Model Context Protocol (MCP) and Agent-to-Agent (A2A) communication extend this vision by making integrations more context aware, dynamic, and intelligent, aligned with how modern AI systems truly operate. In this talk, we will explore how these emerging connection layers are redefining integration. This is not a story of finished architectures; it is a story of shared discovery. Together, we are learning to connect models, organizations, and people through the next generation of interfaces, building a path toward AI integration as the next chapter of digital connection.

sessions.title: The Design of MCP Servers
sessions.description: AI desperately needs access to external resources to get accurate data and interact with the rest of the world. We can leverage MCP for that. MCP servers are literally APIs for AI users. Does that make their design different from regular APIs? To answer this question, we'll overview the basics of MCP and discuss various elements of API/MCP design.

sessions.title: Fight or Flight: Secure your Agentic AI Strategy for 2026
sessions.description: In the fast-moving world of AI and APIs, Model Context Protocol (MCP) is quickly redefining how we integrate with everything. Agentic AI is making autonomous interactions and is powered by MCPs ability to integrate LLMs with, well, pretty much anything. But with great power comes great responsibility. Together, we’ll dive into the headlines and into the code as we explore the basics of MCP servers, agents, and tools along with the vulnerabilities that can be exploited as MCP quickly becomes the de facto standard for organizations and a valuable target for malicious actors. Join Brenton House, AI and API Strategist, for an eye-opening MCP adventure and level up with the keys to securing your Agents, your MCPs, your APIs, your integrations, and your future.

From API-Driven to Domain-Driven to Knowledge-Driven: Building Systems That Understand Their Business
sessions.description:
The API-driven as long as domain driven approches has reshaped the way we build software. It brought modularity, autonomy, and agility, empowering teams to move fast and own their domains. But as systems and organizations scale, a new challenge emerges: the loss of shared meaning.

Each team designs its own APIs, yet no one holds the full picture anymore. Business concepts become fragmented, data loses context, and collective understanding fades behind technical boundaries. The result? Integration pain, governance gaps, and limited capacity to leverage data for AI initiatives.

As ML and Gen AI become central to our architectures, this fragmentation becomes critical. Models can only learn from what the organization can formalize and if business knowledge is scattered across APIs, services, and pipelines, AI will never reflect true business intelligence.

This talk explores how to evolve from API-driven to Knowledge-driven systems. We’ll look at how to reconnect business and technology through:

Domain-Driven Design and shared domain models,

explicit semantic structures (knowledge graphs, domain events, metadata),

and continuous feedback loops that make systems truly AI-ready and explainable.

In short: how to move from systems that expose functions to systems that expose intelligence.

sessions.description:
Organisations’ success with API- and AI-enabled products and business models relies on the right cultural mindset, engineering discipline, and commercial pragmatism. In practice, this looks like being really good at things typical “digital native” (or born-tech) organisations do from their early beginnings. For incumbent players in mature industries, many of their API- and AI-enabled transformations can look like adopting these practices themselves.

This session will start with a “fireside chat” between Sebastien Laye, Markus Müller, and Claire Barrett on what API-enabled innovation looks and feels like from their experiences working with and at digital native organisations. The conversation will draw out comparisons and lessons for organisations in incumbent / mature industries.

The remainder of the session will include global themes and lessons from 10 prior API Economy Summits that have been run since September 2024. This part will be highly interactive, with opportunities for people to share their own stories, examples and learnings, in facilitated round table conversations.

This is your opportunity to get practical lessons and case studies to take away for you and your teams to grow their API economy participation and success.

This session will be moderated by Bertrand Masson and run as a bilingual English/French session.

What if Your API Spoke Accessibility?
sessions.description:
APIs shape the user experience long before UI code is written, but accessibility is almost always left until the end. What if we shifted that left? This talk shows how to embed accessibility metadata directly into GraphQL schemas using custom directives and code generation. This enables clients (Android, iOS, and web) to get accessible defaults from day one. We’ll cover the directive design, how to expose metadata in generated types, and how frontends like Jetpack Compose or SwiftUI consume it. You’ll leave with schema snippets you can copy & paste, strategies to introduce this in your own APIs, and a blueprint for making accessibility part of your developer experience, not an afterthought. A repository with working code examples will be provided.

Key Takeaways:

  • Encode accessibility in your API contract with GraphQL directives.
  • Deliver accessibility metadata to clients automatically
  • Ensure consistency on multiple platforms

sessions.title: Unlocking the future of mobility: How APIs are revolutionizing Ticketing and Transportation Platforms
sessions.description:
The mobility industry has undergone a profound transformation over the past few years. Today, there is an incredible growth of platforms enabling passengers to purchase tickets from various sources—trains, buses, and mobility partners—creating a seamlessly connected experience.

However, this success brings new challenges. How to provide a cohesive view and seamless experience to our customers while integrating with different actors ? How do we communicate across diverse systems using standardized interfaces without constantly reinventing the wheel?

In this talk, we will explore how the transportation industry is driving its own revolution through emerging standards and interfaces. Drawing from our experience with multiple projects, we will highlight the main challenges faced and share practical solutions to overcome them.

By the end of this session, you will have a clear understanding of the upcoming standards and best practices to build cutting-edge transportation and mobility platforms leveraging APIs.

speakers.name: Benoit Quevat
speakers.jobtitle: Responsable de projet Mobility As A Service

sessions.title: Prototyping APIs with OpenAPI
sessions.description:
OpenAPI is widely recognized as the standard for documenting production APIs. But its true potential goes far beyond documentation. In this talk, I’ll demonstrate how OpenAPI can serve as a powerful tool for prototyping APIs, enabling teams to accelerate delivery, reduce risks, and improve collaboration.

By starting with an API contract, you unlock an entire ecosystem of tools: mock servers, client SDK generators, and interactive documentation that work without a single line of backend code. This approach creates a fast feedback loop where stakeholders can experiment with endpoints, validate request/response structures, and surface assumptions early.

Prototyping with OpenAPI also allows parallel development: front-end teams and external consumers can build against a mocked API, while backend engineers refine implementation in the background. The result is fewer bottlenecks, faster iteration, and earlier validation of real-world use cases.

Moreover, by defining schemas, authentication flows, and error responses up front, you can catch inconsistencies and design flaws before they become expensive mistakes. This ensures alignment between business goals and technical requirements, reducing rework and increasing confidence in the final product.

Attendees will leave with practical insights into how OpenAPI can transform their API design process into a design-first, collaborative practice that leads to better APIs: faster, leaner, and with fewer surprises.

speakers.name: Bruno Pedro
speakers.jobtitle: Author of Building an API Product

sessions.title: From Vibe to Velocity with API Context Plugins
sessions.description:
AI coding assistants are transforming how developers write software, but they remain fundamentally unreliable for production-grade API integration. Moreover, current AI code-generation benchmarks emphasize functional correctness while ignoring two critical dimensions of real-world engineering: algorithmic efficiency and code quality.

In this talk, we introduce the concept of API Context Plugins as a new paradigm for enabling AI assistants to generate code for API integration. By supplying assistants with deterministic SDKs and API context, they can dramatically reduce hallucinations and token usage by up to 75%. Drawing on metrics inspired by Codility's COMPASS framework, we evaluate correctness, efficiency, and code quality to demonstrate how deterministic API context fundamentally elevates AI-assisted coding.

This session will showcase why the future of coding isn't AI alone, it's AI empowered with deterministic tools that take your APIs exactly where your developers code.

sessions.title: Zero-Trust by Design: Turning One e-Commerce API into Condor’s Enterprise Backbone
sessions.description:
Condor Airlines transformed a fragile legacy interface into a Zero Trust API platform that now powers nearly every booking, finance, and customer-touch point across the airline. The journey shows how a self-hosted AWS stack can satisfy Europe’s rising demands for data sovereignty and security while staying agile for upcoming AI workloads

Why it matters Airlines are pouring record budgets—US $37 billion in 2024 alone—into digital backbones and cybersecurity, yet most still rely on perimeter auth and siloed portals that leak sensitive flight data. Condor proves you can go Zero Trust-by-design without vendor lock-in or latency trade-offs.

What I’ll cover

  • From perimeter to policy-as-code — OAuth 2.0 + API keys enforced in the pipeline.
  • Quality gates as an “immune system” — Qualys, Veracode and fail-fast rules that slashed defect escape rates.
  • Self-hosted AWS stack — API Gateway, Lambda and IaC patterns that keep costs predictable and migration paths open.
  • Twin developer portals, one trust model — identical auth for staff and travel-agency partners cut onboarding from 12 weeks to four.
  • Business impact — 90 % of digital workflows ride the backbone; credential-leak incidents dropped to zero; ancillary-revenue APIs ship twice as fast.

Who it’s for & take-aways Platform engineers, API product owners, and security architects will leave with:

  1. A build-vs-buy decision tree for Zero Trust API platforms.
  2. Reusable CI/CD templates and cost/latency benchmarks to plug into their own pipelines.
  3. A playbook for selling API-first culture to ops and finance—proving security and speed aren’t trade-offs. Attendees walk away ready to turn a “simple API” into a verifiable, enterprise-grade backbone—without losing agility, budget, or sovereignty.

sessions.title: AI-powered APIs: engineering context in LLM pipelines
sessions.description:
With structured outputs, we’ve finally reached the point where AI can respond to API calls like any other service. But the technology is still young, and its sharp corners are as numerous as its advantages. In “AI-powered APIs: Engineering Context in LLM Pipelines,” we will focus on the practical engineering needed to make these systems dependable.

This talk shows how to design API-first pipelines where every step has a clear contract and every model output is structured, validated, and immediately reusable by the next component. We’ll dig into context engineering: what to keep, what to discard, how to transform free-form reasoning into concise artifacts, and why “output is input” must guide your architecture.

Expect concrete patterns for schema enforcement, retries and error recovery, caching and replay, and live evaluation—so you can build fast, testable, and production-ready AI-powered pipelines.

tags.title: The new AI ang Agentic Gateway stack

speakers.name: Sergey Konstantinov
speakers.jobtitle: Staff Software Engineer, Group Tech Lead

sessions.title: From AuthN to AuthZ: The Future of Identity
sessions.description:
As we shift from web interfaces to agent-driven interactions, the role of identity is changing. Authentication (AuthN) is no longer enough—authorization (AuthZ), lifecycle management, and trust between agents, users, and organizations are becoming critical. At the same time, cybercrime is exploding, and enterprises are struggling to protect users while enabling innovation.

This talk explores how secure management of workforce identity can be made available to every organization and SaaS app, why today’s SSO models fall short, and what trends like the EU Digital Identity Wallet reveal about the future. We’ll look at how emerging patterns can eliminate the “SSO tax,” empower developers, and give users more control—all while reducing risk.

sessions.title: Lunch Break / Networking / Expo
Introduction ALLIANCY
Mastercard are saving millions of dollars and hundreds of MTC02. Now it is time for Europe-driven success

speakers.name: Luca Montecchiani
speakers.jobtitle: Head of Public Cloud Infrastructure Governance and FinOps

sessions.title: Architecture MACH
MCP at 1. The state of the protocol you love (or hate)
sessions.description:
Model Context Protocol (MCP) recently turned one, and there’s never been a technology with so much buzz in such a short time.

We’ll take a critical look at the current state of the protocol as of today:

  • Who’s using it to build a business
  • Real-world use cases and adoption
  • The current state of the spec
  • Gaps that need to be addressed in the future
  • The ever-present security vs. utility discussion (remember, the “S” in MCP stands for security!)

Join us as we examine the present and future of MCP and its impact on your product strategy.

sessions.title: Working Together: What Google Technical Writers Learned by Coming Together to Adopt AI
sessions.description:
Google has a lot of technical writers using internal tooling and publishing to an internal platform. Most writers work in fairly small teams, or even as sole writers embedded into an engineering team. While we have shared tooling, these teams work in quite different ways, serve different audiences, and often have quite different problems to solve.

As AI swept across the industry and our company, we encountered the same concerns, problems, and opportunities as technical writers outside of Google. Initially, senior writers and leads across the company were trying to figure out what it meant alone. In Chrome I was trying to support my team—those who were excited and those who were worried—while trying to figure out what I thought about it all myself!

Thankfully, I wasn't on my own for long. This talk will share some of what happened when a bunch of technical writers from across the company got together as an ""AI for Authors"" working group. Together we're finding ways to increase velocity, improve quality, and reduce toil. Much of what we've learned is generally applicable, outside of the Google tech stack, and I hope will inspire you to get together with fellow writers to work together to take advantage of AI.

speakers.name: Rachel Andrew
speakers.jobtitle: Developer Content Lead for Google Chrome

sessions.title: Panel :  The State of the API Industry Market 2025: An exclusive Report
Designing Enterprise APIs in the AI Age: 5 Hard-Earned Lessons
sessions.description: We’ll dive into 5 practical and actionable lessons for designing resilient, high-performing enterprise APIs based on real-world data from over 15K APIs handling billions of monthly requests.

sessions.title: Moving from LLM Gateways to a Single Agent Origin
sessions.description:
AI gateways were designed for LLMs, but agents demand more - executing actions like trip planning or web searches, not just autocompleting text. Block/goose, built with LLMs and Model Context Protocol (MCP), delivers flexible, action-driven results. Envoy AI Gateway, co-founded by Bloomberg and Tetrate, evolved from LLM abstraction to power Tetrate Agent Router Service (TARS), now a key goose LLM provider.

Since June 2025, MCP’s growth has integrated SaaS tools like GitHub, Postman, Context7, PGA, and Kiwi.

This talk reveals how we designed the gateway’s agent layer and tested it with Goose recipes for robust end-to-end workflows. We'll cover tricky technical areas around authorization, as well what sort of features a gateway provides, to help make your agents more robust.

Key Takeaways:

  • How to use a single origin for LLM and MCP calls, and what that gives you
  • Reuse multi-step workflows with Goose recipes.
  • Recent shifts in MCP landscape and how first party SaaS services change things

sessions.title: API Economy Summit: Meeting API Ambitions…Over Time
sessions.description:
Large organisations, particularly those with mature products and services across profitable markets around the globe, can find their API plans and ambitions may change significantly from their initial ideas, to what they end up actually achieving and going forward with.

Germán Hütterman leads Schneider Electric’s IoT and Data Platform products with experience designing and implementing API-related programs and teams at globally recognised brand businesses.

This session will take a deep dive into Germán and his colleagues’ experiences with taking API-as-products from ideas to plans to the reality of bringing them to life.

From evangelisation to monetisation, from portals to partnerships, from ambitions to reality—this session covers them all from a humble, yet practical, strategy and product perspective.

Germán’s experiences provide case studies and lessons you can apply in your own organisations, use with your teams, and observe at your clients.

This session follows our highly popular format for The API Economy Summit: small format round table conversations of six to eight people per table. You get to hear from Germán and then explore the questions he raises in a structured, while relaxed, setting.

Participants are expected to be commercial, digital or technical practitioners involved in bringing digital and API- or AI-enabled strategies to life in their organisations.

🇬🇧 🇫🇷 This session will be moderated by Bertrand Masson and Claire Barrett and run as a bilingual English/French session.

sessions.title: OpenAPI Masterclass (Registration Required) : API Management for the AI Era: Leveraging OpenAPI Standards
sessions.description: Learn how OpenAPI, Overlays, and Arazzo can modernize your API practices and prepare your ecosystem for AI. Full description and registration: https://apimasters.fr/our-masterclasses

sessions.title: Le futur de la tech sera-t-il californien?
Cloud : Doit on passer de la Souverainté à la Résilience?
Grounding AI Agents with a Governed Universal API Catalog
sessions.description: To evolve from simple text generators into capable assistants, AI agents need the ability to securely discover and execute APIs as tools. This session demonstrates why grounding your agents starts with aggregating your entire API landscape into a governed Universal API Catalog using Apigee API Hub. We will show you how to centralize lifecycle management across Apigee and third-party gateways, creating a single, verified source of truth. Finally, we will detail how to grant agents programmatic access to this catalog, empowering them to autonomously identify and invoke the precise capabilities required to solve complex user requests.

sessions.title: Docs as product: Redefining the API experience
sessions.description: Docs are now the gravity center of AI/API products. Learn how leading teams turn documentation into a dynamic system of knowledge that drives discovery, onboarding, and implementation.

sessions.title: From Chaos to Clarity: AI for API Docs
sessions.description:
In many teams, the path from product idea to API documentation spans multiple worlds. Product managers capture requirements in tools like Confluence or Notion, while engineers define structured specifications in Postman or Swagger. Designers, if involved, think in workflows rather than endpoints. Somewhere between these worlds, consistency, structure, and discoverability often get lost.

This talk explores how Generative AI can bridge those gaps, helping mixed teams co-create and govern API specifications and documentation without forcing everyone to become OpenAPI experts.

sessions.title: TBD
Carmen: Amadeus' open-source tool to measure your entire applications portfolio impact
Securing the AI Revolution - MCP Protocol Governance in Enterprise API Infrastructure
sessions.description: The emergence of Model Context Protocol (MCP) APIs in enterprise architecture challenges traditional API security paradigms This presentation will demonstrate practical use cases for MCP API governance, including access control, stream inspection, and observability that balance innovation velocity with security requirements. Attendees will gain actionable insights into preparing their API infrastructure for the MCP protocol wave expected to accelerate through 2026 and beyond, ensuring their organizations can safely harness AI capabilities while maintaining robust security postures.

sessions.title: Beyond "One-Size-Fits-All": A Blueprint for Custom API Governance That Delivers Results
sessions.description: Most enterprise API governance models fail, creating friction for developers and critical gaps for attackers. How do you build a program that delivers executive-level results? This session presents a practical blueprint for a custom API security and data governance framework designed for the modern enterprise. We will explore how to balance agility with control through a federated, persona-driven model. Attendees will learn how to automate security directly into the API lifecycle, gain full visibility across their API landscape, and implement a scalable program that effectively protects enterprise data while accelerating business innovation.

sessions.title: From Web APIs to a Web of Capabilities. The journey to AI Integration.
sessions.description:
The industry is caught between maximalist AI predictions leading to frequent failure to operationalize proofs of concepts, and the pragmatic, often difficult reality of enterprise integration. While AI promises transformation, its true success hinges on moving beyond the generation of MCP wrappers for existing APIs, or using unsecure and inconsistent connector SDKs or manual API scripting that dominate our current landscape. These classic integrations were not designed for the dynamic, autonomous needs of AI agents, creating a significant barrier to value.

This session argues for a fundamental shift in perspective: from static Web APIs to dynamic ""Capabilities” truly enabling AI integration. We will define what Capabilities are—discoverable, composable, and governed units of business function—and explore how they elevate traditional APIs from simple contracts to AI-ready polyglot tools. We will then introduce the ""Capability Fabric,"" a new architectural pattern, alternative to Service Mesh, and designed to manage these capabilities at scale. We'll demonstrate how this fabric provides the necessary governance, composition, and observability for AI-driven interactions, aligning perfectly with modern practices like Domain-Driven Design and Platform Engineering.

Finally, we will zoom out from the enterprise to the broader ecosystem, positing the emergence of a ""Web of Capabilities."" This new, Agentic Web is poised to finally deliver on the dynamic, autonomous potential that the Semantic Web once promised but could not achieve, ushering in a new era of informed and purposeful agents at the service of humans.

sessions.title: Distributed Docs: How We Slashed Build Times and Focused on LLM-Ready Content Generation
sessions.description: Hear why we recently spent a year transforming our documentation system. We moved from a monolithic build process to a distributed model, cutting our build time from 3.5 hours to just 3 minutes. By pre-building linkable resource maps and integrating isolated content sources, we’ve streamlined workflows and made documentation more scalable. Our tooling now automatically generates LLM-ready content—like consumable text and embeddings—sitting in the background and getting out of the way, allowing engineering teams to focus on writing great content for wider consumption.

sessions.title: Connecting the Enterprise: Embracing API-first Technology to Future-Proof your Revenue and Contracting Processes
sessions.description: Revenue acceleration and risk mitigation shouldn’t cost efficiency. Increase your margins and compliance with Conga’s open, AI-powered platform streamlining and automating quotes and contracts.

sessions.title: Sustainable Digital Challenge: Award Ceremony
Governance and Security of APIs and MCPs
sessions.description: MCP are emerging as the standard to equip agents with tools. Many people are looking at wrapping APIs as MCPs to quickly get something to work with, but this is not without consequences. As for APIs, MCPs need to be designed, governed and secured. This talk walks us through approaches to safely use MCPs and avoiding repeating the same errors we did with APIs: put security last.

sessions.title: Où en est aujourd’hui l’autonomie stratégique numérique de l’Europe ??
Operating APIs in the Age of AI Spikes
sessions.description: AI agents, super-apps, and open ecosystems are reshaping consumption patterns — and multiplying operational risk. Enterprises can’t afford APIs that “usually” work anymore. Platforms must be predictable, observable, and resilient while everything around them changes quickly. This session focuses on how to engineer APIOps for AI-driven scale: real-time telemetry, dynamic policymaking, automated compliance, production safeguards, and safe version rollout that prevents breaking changes — all while maintaining delivery velocity across distributed teams. Drawing on years of leading global API platform operations, Mark Hawkins shares proven engineering practices for environments where downtime is not an option. Leave with a practical playbook to keep your API platforms fast, stable, and trusted — especially as adoption surges.

sessions.title: We built our own general-purpose agent! Here’s how
Controlling AI Sprawl for Secure Innovation
sessions.description: Discover how to control AI sprawl, protect sensitive data, and enable secure, scalable innovation as AI projects accelerate.

sessions.title: From API Gateways to AI Model Registries: How ADEO Is Structuring Enterprise-Grade LLM Usage
sessions.description: AI is reshaping the enterprise landscape, and ADEO is taking a bold stance: treating AI Gateways as the new model registries for LLMs. This session will show how this approach standardizes model usage, enforces governance, and delivers measurable improvements in security and output quality. We’ll explore the architectural decisions behind this shift and why they signal a major evolution for the API ecosystem.

sessions.title: From REST APIs to Event Streaming and GraphQL
sessions.description: At Volvo, we have started our integration journey with API platform. We are advancing to bring modern integrations platforms such as Event Streaming powered by Kafka and GraphQL which has been recently gone live.

sessions.title: How to use Jira for API Governance
sessions.description:
This talk explores how Stryka IO has built an API Governance tool using out-of-the-box Jira features for our clients. This approach enables customers to track different aspects of API governance and eliminates the need for multiple, often out-of-sync systems of record for their API Product Portfolio.

Most organisations want a robust API Governance and Lifecycle Management solution that integrates well with existing internal systems while keeping costs low.

Many software development teams already use Jira for project lifecycle management. With its rich ecosystem of out-of-the-box integrations and ability to link efforts across teams, we identified Jira as an excellent, cost-effective solution for API Governance. Combined with Jira's automations, exposed APIs, MCPs, and Confluence embeddings, it becomes a solid tool for API Governance within an existing company's ecosystem.

In this talk, I'll show you how to build a simple API Governance tool in Jira that enables effective, centralised communication with relevant stakeholders and external tools. I'll give a complete end-to-end demo of how you can design, structure, automate, and expose all the relevant aspects needed for API Governance and DevEx.

sessions.title: How Generative AI Apps Use APIs
sessions.description: The next wave of API consumers looks to be generative AI applications. Ryan will review approaches to API usage in AI, with a focus on RAG and Agents. He will also explore the major tool-calling LLMs from vendors such as OpenAI and Anthropic and demonstrate agent frameworks such as LangGraph.

sessions.title: Sovereign APIs: Harnessing GenAI Without Losing Control
sessions.description: GenAI doesn’t have to be a black box or a security liability. In this talk, we explore how to build sovereign GenAI capabilities by exposing them as clean, well-designed API endpoints—just like any other service in your platform. We’ll walk through how organizations can self-host GenAI models with the same patterns they already use for API workloads, ensuring full control over data, compliance, performance, and cost. From infrastructure and isolation strategies to model routing and security hardening, this session shows how to bring GenAI home without sacrificing agility or governance.

sessions.title: From Cabins to Complex Vacations: How Cruise Lines Are Transforming Through API-First Innovation
sessions.description:
Cruise industry is experiencing a massive shift — moving from selling cabins to delivering personalized, complex vacation experiences that span pre-cruise, onboard, and post-cruise journeys. This evolution is driven by unprecedented demand and changing guest expectations.

To succeed, cruise lines must take an API-first approach, treating APIs as strategic products rather than just integrations. In this session, we’ll share how we are helping some of the world’s largest cruise lines make this leap, and share specifics on some key themese including designing clear, consistent APIs using OpenAPI, automating transformation of single APIs into unique custom versions using Overlay, building custom API pipeline management tooling for accelerating API transformation.

We’ll also explore the next frontier: Agentic AI, where APIs must evolve to support autonomous agents that shop, plan, and transact on behalf of customers.

Attendees will gain practical insights into building scalable, future-ready APIs for complex travel ecosystems and see how lessons from cruise retailing can apply across the broader travel tech landscape. This talk bridges modern API practices, real-world case studies, and forward-looking AI trends — offering a roadmap for anyone driving digital transformation in travel.

speakers.name: Santhosh Jose
speakers.jobtitle: Product Manager, API, Data and AI

sessions.title: Building Agentic Workflows: Patterns for Orchestrating Intelligent Systems
sessions.description:
AI agents are everywhere, from copilots and autonomous assistants to workflow engines that reason, plan, and act. However, while the industry often discusses what agents are and why they matter, we rarely examine how they’re truly built. This talk dives deep into the “how” of agentic systems — unveiling the orchestration patterns that power reliable, flexible, and context-aware AI agents. We’ll move beyond the hype to explore practical design strategies that structure agent behavior across single and multi-agent setups. We’ll explore:

  • Multiple Agentic Orchestration Patterns and strategies, and how Agents use reasoning loops(ReAct), tool calling, etc, to plan and execute sequences and actions intelligently.
  • Decision frameworks for choosing between different approaches based on complexity, specialization, etc By the end, you’ll walk away with a clear blueprint for building agentic workflows, from solo reasoning loops to fully orchestrated, human-aware systems, and a mental model for what separates today’s toy agents from tomorrow’s real, production-grade intelligence.

sessions.title: DOCS : l'histoire d'un logiciel open source co-crée à l'echelle EU
API Darwinism: Evolve your APIs or Vanish in the Agentic AI Era
sessions.description: In the age of Agentic AI, only the adaptable survive. APIs are no longer just digital plumbing; they’re the lifeblood of intelligent systems. As AI reshapes how applications are built, managed, and secured, legacy API strategies are becoming evolutionary dead ends. This session explores how AI-infused API management can help your organization evolve; accelerating innovation, amplifying agility, and creating new competitive advantages. You’ll see how the fusion of AI and APIs is spawning a new species of digital ecosystem, where smart, adaptive APIs don’t just serve data, they shape business outcomes.

sessions.title: Coffee Break / Networking / Expo
Old Tech, New Tricks: Architecting High-Performance A*I Gateways
sessions.description:
Everyone is rushing to deploy AI, but few are talking about how to manage the traffic. We stylize it as A*I Gateways for a reason: the blueprint for successful AI infrastructure is already written in the history of API Gateways.

In this session, we stop reinventing the wheel. We will dust off the "decades-old" Load Balancer to demonstrate how proven API patterns are the secret weapon for handling the high-compute, high-latency nature of LLMs.

Key Takeaways:

  • Boost Performance: Slash latency by offloading TLS processing, implementing aggressive caching, and multiplexing connections.

  • Harden Security: Stop threats at the door with pre-authentication and bot blocking before they hit your expensive models.

  • Scale Globally: Deploy a multi-region service mesh that routes traffic intelligently across the globe.

Join us to learn how to transform standard load balancing patterns into a cutting-edge A*I Gateway that solves the "heavy" nature of LLM requests. We will move beyond basic routing to build a Universal Mesh that ensures your AI services are fast, secure, and globally available.

sessions.title: Beyond Text: Building Video Documentation with AI
sessions.description:
Developer documentation has always been written — but what happens when it starts to speak, move, and respond? At Cloudflare, we’re exploring how video can make documentation more engaging, accessible, and discoverable. This talk shares the messy, practical story of turning traditional docs into multimodal experiences. We’ll look at how Cloudflare’s Product Content Experience (PCX) team sources video scripts directly from documentation, uses AI for scripting, feedback and catalog, and experiments with ways to make these assets searchable and usable by both humans and machines. You’ll learn what’s working (and what isn’t) when adding video to developer documentation, how lightweight AI tools accelerate production, and how even simple automation can help teams scale and structure knowledge in new ways.

In this session, you’ll learn: How to turn existing documentation into engaging video content that stays accurate and on-brand Practical AI workflows for narration, transcription, and feedback — without needing to be an AI expert How structured metadata and AI retrieval can make video documentation discoverable for both people and machines.

sessions.title: Carbon accounting at scale: how Crédit Agricole Group Infrastructure Platform fosters its low-carbon transformation
How to Position your organization as an AI Leader
sessions.description: Unlocking the full potential of agentic AI hinges on a secure and well-governed API landscape. Learn how API & AI governance, real-time monitoring and advanced security allow you to create a robust architecture for today whilst fuelling your AI initiatives. Position your organisation as an AI leader with a resilient and compliant API architecture.

sessions.title: Secure Your MCP Servers with OAuth, JWT, SPIFFE and More
sessions.description:
You have built your first MCP server and tested it with the MCP Inspector, but it currently runs over stdio or streamable HTTP without HTTPS. Now you are asking yourself: should you rewrite your server to add authentication and authorization, or is there a smarter approach? And what happens when you scale to multiple MCP servers? Do you really need to modify each one?

In this demo-driven session, Lin first shows the hard way: modifying MCP server code to add OAuth support, then rebuilding and redeploying. After that, she introduces a simpler method that offloads authentication and authorization through an MCP gateway, which allows you to secure your servers using OAuth, JWT, SPIFFE and other identity systems without changing or redeploying them. Finally, she shows how her AI agent interacts with the MCP server tools securely, with proper authentication and access control.

sessions.title: Résilience & souveraineté : bâtir une IA autonome et durable

speakers.name: Noe Achache
speakers.jobtitle: Group Associate Partner, Head of AI Engineering

sessions.title: Opensource API Tools to agile your apifirst strategy
sessions.description: We will to speak about the steps for apifirst and how to can use apitools opensource to check all steps, from designt, to validate, create microservice, mocking, testing, stress tests and security tests

sessions.title: Optimize your Architecture for the next wave of AI-infused Apps
sessions.description: Today’s conversations about AI are all about LLMs (large language models like ChatGPT) and about creating predictive models to assist decision making. But an AI application is more than that. Designing an AI application has challenges that a traditional application does not. The success rate for deploying AI-infused apps into production is still too low. Application architecture for AI poses different challenges to architects and developers. Its anatomy is different. How do we take advantage of Agentic AI to integrate intelligence throughout our apps? How do we do this in a way that is not too disruptive and that benefits from past software investments and accumulated experience. What is the right architecture to evolve the application logic, as well as changes in the LLM over time? We will show how the application platform can provide a complete ecosystem for building and integrating Agentic-AI applications, ensuring that they are scalable, resilient, and optimized. We will also show you how this approach is applied to an enterprise use case of leveraging AI agents with MCP to improve customer service and thus increase satisfaction.

sessions.title: Spec-first API designs without codegen
sessions.description: The talk is about keeping the two things that matter at the centre: The Users and the spec, the OpenAPI spec and how to design your code around it. It talks about the various real life challenges of not doing this and things like generating code and how popular opensource tooling can address this. It gives a practical way to approach this problem and work with teams at scale. This has already been presented at apidays London 2025.

sessions.title: API Economy Summit: Convincing the Unconvinced
sessions.description:
To celebrate the final API Economy Summit for 2025, this session will drive into a recurring topic over the previous 10 summits across five cities around the world: getting others to “get” what The API Economy is all about.

In seemingly AI-saturated conversations, the need for a clearly defined stable of API products has never been greater. Yet too many people tell us that they still struggle to get their colleagues, even their customers or their partners, fully on board with understanding the potential from participation in the API Economy.

This session is about sharing what works (or otherwise) with convincing the unconvinced about the API Economy. Why it matters. Where to get education and training. How to grow understanding and involvement, and lead to results.

This session is a facilitated round table discussion on the methods and techniques to get others committed to action towards making it their business to understand the business of APIs.

🇬🇧 🇫🇷 Bertrand Masson and Claire Barrett are seasoned change agents who work with their consulting clients and other API economy thinkers to help them articulate and realise their API ambitions. This session will be run as a bilingual English/French session.

speakers.name: Claire Barrett
speakers.company: APIsFirst and Co-lead of Women In APIs

sessions.title: Concilier résilience et performance : quels leviers pour y parvenir ?
MCP: Is GraphQL the Right “Tool” For the Job?
sessions.description: GraphQL, secure? What an outlandish statement.” – and that’s exactly where this talk begins. While GraphQL is often seen as flexible and developer-friendly, its open nature makes it risky to expose directly to AI. In this session, we’ll explore how a collection of curated GraphQL operations, powered by Persisted Operations and the Model Context Protocol (MCP), turns that assumption on its head. Drawing on our work at WunderGraph, we’ll show how action-oriented, job-to-be-done operations can safely connect APIs to LLMs, keeping token usage low, requests predictable, and data access under control. Join us to discuss what secure GraphQL for AI really looks like – and how to make it work in practice.

sessions.title: An open grammar and style checker
sessions.description:
Vale was created as open source language “linter” to help people check their text for grammar and style rules, violations, and style. Especially in technical audiences, Vale has proven popular with several high profile companies and teams using it and a healthy ecosystem of rulesets and tooling.

However, for the most part Vale uses regular expression to check text and while this is effective, it means Vale has no context of what you’re actually writing. As an open source, locally run tool, this was always the point, but in the times of an AI writing assistant almost everywhere, people have come to expect more.

This presentation shows how efforts using the Vale MCP server and open models (as possible) are attempting to create a smarter, text assistant that merges Vale’s highly configurable rules with the power of LLMs to create an open and self-sovereign alternative to other closed source grammar checking tools.

sessions.title: Semantic Metadata using Taxi and how they're using it on their API Specs (OpenAPI, Avro, etc) to keep systems decoupled, and drive rapid change
In GenAI era: Designing, Building and Optimizing APIs with API Green Score Framework
sessions.description:
There is no AI at scale without APIs, so well designed and hosted api is very important.

APIs are the backbone of modern digital services and GenAI transformation, but they also contribute to our growing digital carbon footprint.

In this hands-on technical workshop, you'll dive into the API Green Score framework to measure and reduce the environmental impact of your APIs.

Through coding sessions, you'll learn

  • how to analyze API behavior
  • optimize data flows
  • apply sustainable design patterns in real time.

Using the open-source training project, we’ll explore tools, metrics, and automation strategies that help you build APIs that are not only fast and scalable, but also environmentally responsible.

Bring your laptop and your curiosity, this is where clean code meets clean energy.

sessions.title: The Invisible Cloud: Solving the Kubernetes Carbon Mystery
Using semantic metadata in APIs to build self-repairing stacks
sessions.description:
Enterprises are a mix of different teams, technologies, languages, and specs. That’s a feature, not a bug. But bringing these systems together often involves layers of manual integration that are hard to maintain.

In this talk, we’ll explore how adding semantic metadata to existing API specs – OpenAPI, AsyncAPI, Protobuf, Avro – can unlock a self-repairing federation layer.

Using Taxi – an open source language for adding semantics to API specs – we’ll show how APIs, Kafka topics, serverless functions, and even S3 buckets can be exposed as interoperable, discoverable components in a federated architecture.

This enables on-demand integration, reduces tight coupling, and lets APIs evolve without breaking downstream consumers. It’s not magic – just a practical way to make distributed systems more robust.

sessions.title: Orchestrating APIs for LLMs - Agentic Workflows for GraphQL
sessions.description: As Large Language Models (LLMs) become increasingly integral to application development, a critical challenge emerges: how do we efficiently connect these models to the APIs they need without wasting valuable compute resources on orchestration? This presentation introduces a powerful solution through a graph representation of your APIs. We'll explore how offloading API orchestration from LLMs to a dedicated GraphQL layer creates more capable, efficient AI agents. Rather than forcing your LLM to manage complex sequences of API calls, learn how a graph representation can provide your agents with the precise context they need to solve specific problems. The session will demonstrate practical implementation techniques, showcasing how GraphQL's declarative schema-driven approach creates an ideal abstraction layer between your applications and underlying services. We’ll show an agentic developer workflow to quickly build a graph representation of your APIs using GraphOS MCP Tools (no signup or complex setup needed). By the end of this talk, you'll understand how GraphQL's declarative and composable nature makes it an ideal abstraction layer to support all of your applications and agents. You'll leave with actionable knowledge to immediately enhance applications through more intelligent API orchestration strategies.

sessions.title: Who really controls your cloud: you, or your vendor?
Curious how your Developer Portal measures up against Award Winners?
sessions.description:
Everyone wants a better developer portal. But what does “better” mean in your specific context? More documentation? New information architecture? Smarter search? An AI chatbot?

Without a clear framework, teams risk spending effort on changes that don’t drive business growth or docs maturity. Want a list of action points to improve your portal?

This session will help you understand where your portal stands today and how to plan your next steps toward maturity.

Assess your current portal and identify meaningful areas for improvement Align cross-functional teams around shared goals Build data-driven arguments for change and secure stakeholder buy-in Bonus: I will show you the winners of the Developer Portal Awards.

sessions.title: The marathon of scaling Green IT on 5 continents
Après la Souveraineté
Building the API-Driven Future of European Payments
sessions.description:
European payments are entering a new cycle—one where legacy batch architectures, fragmented regulatory landscapes, and increasing resiliency requirements can no longer keep up with the speed, scale, and expectations of modern commerce. As transactions move to real-time, as banks face growing pressure to innovate without compromising sovereignty or security, and as merchants demand smoother, simpler experiences, the underlying payment infrastructure must evolve.

This talk explores how an API-driven approach can redefine payment processing in Europe. Not just as a technical upgrade, but as a foundational shift in how issuing and acquiring services are built, consumed, scaled, and secured.

We’ll look at why traditional processors struggle to adapt, and why the next generation must be configurable, modular, interoperable, and resilient by design. We’ll examine concrete use cases: real-time card lifecycle management, instant merchant funding, unified acceptance flows, and the ability to integrate new payment methods without rewriting the world each time.

Most importantly, we’ll discuss why this matters now: because Europe’s competitiveness in payments depends on its ability to modernize its core infrastructure, without losing control of it.

From architecture principles to strategic implications for banks, this session lays out how Europe can accelerate its API-led transformation and build the payments backbone it truly needs for the decade ahead.

sessions.title: Post-Web Era: How Data Logistics is Becoming Essential and How We Can Manage It
sessions.description: In the emerging "Post-Web era", data logistics is taking on greater importance. It’s not just about automated decisions and frictionless data flow; it’s about a world where autonomous agents and machine-to-machine interactions redefine how we handle knowledge. In this talk, we’ll show how we can balance the power of APIs and autonomous agents, orchestrated by the innovative, open-source, and decentralized Axone protocol. While agents using protocols like MCP can drive machine-to-machine workflows, APIs remain crucial as connective tissue. Axone acts as the orchestrator, enabling both API access management and a semantic layer for agents to negotiate and interact. Today, Dataionics is experimenting with this approach using geospatial data to expand it to all geolocated data and ultimately discuss with the community how to apply this to any data. Join us to explore this journey together.

sessions.title: Lessons from Our API Past: Evolving to a Resilient API Future
sessions.description: APIs are the digital backbone of modern software, powering everything from online banking and retail to AI-powered automation and connected vehicles. They form the foundation of digital transformation strategies, but as their ubiquity grows, so does the impact of their failure. In this talk, we’ll explore the historical pitfalls of API design, the challenges posed by modern microservice architectures, and how contract testing offers a path toward resilient, scalable, and future-ready APIs.

sessions.title: Hello, I'm a Hacker
sessions.description: Let's talk a walk through my eyes in this ever changing world...

sessions.title: Arazzo: Dress up Your API Ecosystem for the AI Revolution!
sessions.description: Discover how OpenAPI Arazzo streamlines API Governance by putting use cases center-stage, enabling modular workflows that are intuitive for both humans and AI agents.

sessions.title: Conference Welcome and OpenAPI in the Age of AI
sessions.description: Welcome to the OpenAPI Conference! We have an exciting program to share, with presentations talking about new specifications as well as presentations that dive into practices, applications, and an outlook of things are going. We also we have a brief look of where OpenAPI is situated in the age of AI and MCP, and how things are going to develope after the recent publication of version 3.2 of the specification.

sessions.title: Kickoff - FINOS The Open Source Tech Stack for Regulated Industries
sessions.description: Let's explore how open source is reshaping the financial services industry, offering a strategic alternative to traditional "buy or build" dilemmas. We’ll dive into the transformative power of collaboration, showcasing how financial institutions—from global banks to fintechs—are leveraging open-source solutions to drive innovation, reduce costs and risks, and navigate regulatory complexity. Discover FINOS (Finance Open Source Foundation), the industry-backed ecosystem providing a compliant, community-driven tech stack for regulated environments, and learn how its projects are solving common shared challenges.

sessions.title: Securing APIs and AI Tools: lessons from the trenches
GraphQL: Untangling under- and overfetching problem at the largest e-commerce in NL/BE
sessions.description:
We'll dive deeper into the concept of the under- and overfetching problems. How GraphQL solves this for us in our organisation at bol, the largest ecommerce of The Netherlands and Belgium. How we entangled our service landscape from the under- and overfetching problem - not only technically but also how GraphQL massively improves our innovation speed and creates an effective WoW in our organisation.

During this talk we'll share concrete examples of the under- and overfetching problems in our service landscape and organisation, and how we solved them.

sessions.title: The $2 Trillion Travel Tech Gap: Why Your API Strategy Fails Without This Missing Ingredient
sessions.description: The travel industry invests billions in APIs and AI, yet 87% of digital transformation projects still fail. Why? We're solving the wrong problem. While the industry obsesses over faster APIs and smarter AI, we're ignoring the critical human element that determines success or failure. Drawing from real-world case studies across luxury hotels, OTAs, and emerging travel startups, this session reveals the education gap that's costing the industry trillions in unrealized potential. You'll discover: • The hidden cost of technical debt in travel APIs (spoiler: it's not what you think) • Why our industries API success isn't about technology—it's about the approach to team education • The ""Intelligence Triangle"": How APIs + AI + Educated Teams create unstoppable competitive advantage • A practical 90-day framework to transform your teams from code executors to innovation drivers • Real examples from digital transformation journey Perfect for: CTOs, Product Leaders, API Architects, and Travel Tech Innovators who want to bridge the gap between cutting-edge technology and human capability. The bottom line: Your next API investment shouldn't be in more features—it should be in the people who make them work.

calendars.title: Travel Tech API Conference: Travel Unlocked!

sessions.title: JSON Schema v1 - No more "drafts"
sessions.description: A common question we hear from JSON Schema users is, when is JSON Schema going to be done? They're concerned that using something called a "draft" is risky and they're frustrated by how many versions of JSON Schema they need to know or support. The next version of JSON Schema, which we're calling "v1", aims to address those concerns. We're overhauling how we make changes and evolve JSON Schema so users can be confident that any updates won't break their schemas and they don't have to change their schemas to start using new features. In this talk, we'll cover a brief history of the evolution of JSON Schema, how that's going to change going forward, how those changes will affect how you manage your schemas, and what changes you can initially expect from the v1 release.

speakers.name: Jason Desrosiers

sessions.title: Strategically planning your API ecosystem model
sessions.description: CxOs struggle to understand how APIs should be hardnessed within business strategy. I present a new method to model API based ecosystems and to better think about them as part of strategy. The work builds on Soft Systems Methodology and Wardley Mapping - both with global followings and deep research. The method helps companies track, plan and think strategically about the use of APIs and intelligent aglorithms. It is based on my own research published in many academic journal and strategy articles. People will go away with a clearer understanding of what to do to think about APIs strategically - and methods to help.

sessions.title: IGT-AI: A Governance Framework for Evaluating AI and MCP Gateways
sessions.description: As organisations build generative-AI and agentic applications, the need for runtime governance of LLM-API usage and MCP server tool interactions continues to grow. Threats such as prompt injection, privacy and compliance risks, and cost overruns from unmonitored token consumption are real, and AI gateways aim to address them. But what factors should you consider when selecting an AI gateway or MCP gateway? In this talk, I present an analysis of the major feature trends in AI gateways and outline the risks they mitigate. I’ll share insights from my reviews of existing tools and leave you with practical tips for choosing an AI gateway that fits your enterprise needs. Target Audience: This session is essential for decision-makers adopting AI-API and MCP governance tooling, as well as API tool vendors developing next-generation AI gateways.

sessions.description: I've used AsyncAPI documents to describe many Kafka applications. In this session, I'll describe what I most often resort to using description free-text or vendor-extensions to describe. I'll ask how many of them you similarly think would be useful, and what else you think I've missed.

sessions.title: HTC-Grid (High Performance Computing)
API as Product: why it matters now, in the age of AI
sessions.description:
In the AI era, your APIs are no longer just interfaces — they are how intelligent agents will understand and consume your business.

Through a benchmark of organizations that have already embraced the API as Product mindset, this talk explores how treating APIs as measurable, owned, and value-driven assets naturally leads to AI readiness.

The companies that took this step didn’t chase AI first — they built the right foundations. Their APIs are clear, consistent, and consumable — by humans today, and by intelligent systems tomorrow.

sessions.title: Composition for the win!
sessions.description:
This talk will explore how we used JSON Schema to harden the API of our IoT connectivity solution, Notecard.

We'll dive into the practical implementation of schema-driven development: enforcing request validation, helping users catch integration errors before they reach production, and automatically generating documentation that stays in sync with the API. You'll see real examples of how JSON Schema transformed our development process, across our Notecard CLI, Developer Docs, programmatic SDK generation and MCP server.

Learn the patterns we discovered for building robust IoT APIs, the tools that made implementation seamless, and how this approach reduced the complexity in both maintaining our hardware API and explaining it to users.

sessions.title: What's new in OpenAPI 3.2
sessions.description:
Keeping up with all the new standards all the time can be hard work! Instead, come to this session and get an overview of what's new in the OpenAPI 3.2 release so you know what to expect when it's time to upgrade.

You'll hear about support for more HTTP methods, multipart formats, and for handling the full query string as one input. There's a big upgrade to tags, allowing nesting, multiple tag types, and more metadata - replacing the extensions you're probably already using with tags. Also included are document identities, security scheme additions, and upgraded support for XML-format APIs.

Come along to learn more and prepare for the future!

sessions.title: How Gentour Turns Catalogs, Conversations, and Itineraries into APIs
sessions.description: The travel industry is still locked into silos: static PDFs, scattered supplier feeds, and fragmented booking flows. For OTAs, tour operators, TMCs, and their partners (GDS, bedbanks, consolidators), this means friction, slow quoting, and missed opportunities.Gentour.ai is built to unlock this complexity by making AI work at the API level — and remaining AI-agnostic (OpenAI, Mistral, Gemini, or any LLM). We’ll showcase three real-world use cases: From PDF to API: Upload a circuit brochure or pricing grid, let Gentour structure it, and expose it as a consistent product/catalog API. From Chat to API: Sales agents start with a natural conversation; Gentour normalizes it into actionable travel recommendations via API. From Basket to API: Combine flights, hotels, and packages from multiple (online and/or static files) suppliers, add commercial rules, and output a sellable, client-facing itinerary or PDF — all available through a single API. Business impact: faster time-to-quote, higher conversion, reusable catalogs, and simplified partner integrations. Technical snapshot: AI-Agnostic architecture Custom agent architecture for memory aware conversations: LangGraph StateGraph with custom nodes & real time context injection per user Multi-Modal Intelligence Event-Driven Processing Unified endpoints: one REST API aggregates all travel supplier APIs.
